message.content: This question requires knowledge about the composition of marble and the way light interacts with it. As you look deeper into a marble, you are able to see minute defects or imperfections in the stone. Option (A) is incorrect because looking into a marble does not allow you to see the future. Option (C) is partially correct because there can be colors within the marble due to impurities or the way light interacts with it, but the main focus of seeing deeper into the marble is the defects. Option (D) is incorrect because unless the marble is transparent or has openings, you would not be able to see the other side.
